titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joel B. Levinson Photographs, 1950-2006 AIS.2015.01
titlestmt.author: Elizabeth England.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:06:07 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Joel B. Levinson, an independent photographer in Pittsburgh, Pa., who worked primarily in the 1980s and 1990s, produced numerous calendars, postcards, and photographic essays highlighting the people, events, and structures of the city under the name Pittsburghscape. The collection is comprised of approximately 7,000 items and includes photographic prints, slides, negatives, positives, and manuscript materials related to Levinson's photography of the Pittsburgh region that showcase the diversity of his subject matter.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Joel B. Levinson was born in Pittsburgh, Pa., in 1934, where he remained for most of his life. His varied career included working as a businessman, an engineer, industrial appraiser, and a photographer. After graduating from Carnegie Tech in 1956, Levinson married Toba Goldenfeld in 1957. In 1958 he began working for Levinson Steel, the nationally-known company founded in 1902 by his grandfather, where he remained until the company was sold in 1983. In the late 1970s, Levinson began extensively photographing the structures and people of the Pittsburgh region.

After publishing his first photographic essay with Lynn Johnson in 1984, entitled "Pittsburgh Moments," Levinson's interest in documenting numerous aspects of Pittsburgh increased to a self-described "love affair with the city." Around this time, he began producing calendars, postcards, and prints of the Pittsburgh region under the name Pittsburghscape. Throughout the 1980s and 1990s, Levinson, alongside assistant Susan Nega, photographed Pittsburgh's landscape, events, attractions, and residents. Levinson and Nega jointly managed their commercial photography business, J.B. Jeffers Ltd.

In 1991, Levinson released another photographic essay, "Pittsburgh: Views between the Rivers," which he updated and expanded in 1996 under the new title "Pittsburgh: Views into the 21st Century." In 2000, he moved to Boulder, Co., to be closer to family. Levinson revised the essay again in 2004, including additional photographs and modifying the text to reflect the changing city which he still photographed when visiting. "Pittsburgh: Views in the 21st Century" was Levinson's last homage to the city he dearly loved. Levinson's passion for photography was passed along to his children and grandchildren, many of whom have become photographers as well. He passed away on October 26, 2007 in Boulder.

Susan Nega was born in Pittsburgh and graduated from Penn Hills High School. She attended the University of Pittsburgh where she obtained a degree in Liberal Arts with a focus mainly on photography and film studies (class of 1989). With a love of photography, working in the darkroom, and exploring the city, she went to work for Joel Levinson at J.B. Jeffers Ltd., a publishing company specializing in images of Pittsburgh's cityscapes, neighborhoods, attractions and events, and people. Joel's mentoring provided new ways of seeing the city, its people, and capturing what is special in everyday surroundings. After 10 years at J.B. Jeffers Ltd., publishing calendars, postcards, and a book of the city, Susan (and her husband) decided to move to New York City. She worked for a short time at the publisher Fotofolio Inc., which was also a publisher of books, postcards, notecards, and posters of fine art and photography.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The organization for the Levinson photographs has been kept largely in its original order, with some shifting to bring items from the same events back together. The collection is organized by events or themes, although there is no chronological order. Images and materials relating to Levinson's publications are primarily contained in boxes 5 through 7.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Joel B. Levinson Photographs, 1950-2006, AIS.2015.01, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joel B. Levinson Photographs, 1950-2006, AIS.2015.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Joel B. Levinson Photographs is comprised of approximately 7,000 items and includes photographic prints, slides, negatives, positives, and manuscript materials related to his photography of the Pittsburgh region. Items date from 1968 to 2006 with the bulk of the collection dating from the 1980s and 1990s.

Levinson loved to document his hometown and was a frequent fixture at cultural and sporting events such as the Pittsburgh Marathon, Vintage Grand Prix, Three Rivers Arts Festival, and Three Rivers Regatta. He was particularly struck by the Pittsburgh skyline and would return to the same locations many times over the course of his career to capture Pittsburgh's evolving landscapes and built environments.
While Levinson is the primary photographer, the work of Levinson's assistant (Susan Nega), his sons (Jeff and Drew), along with John Beale, Leo Hsu, and Norman Schumm are also included.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Levinson Steel Company Records, 1926-1985, MSS 1042, Rauh Jewish Archives, Thomas and Katherine Detre Library and Archives, Senator John Heinz History Center

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jeffery B., Toba, Eric, Drew and Mark Levinson on March 2015.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Elizabeth England in August 2016.
